summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, dated August 8, 2019. It appoints three executors to manage his estate, directs the payment of debts and expenses, and bequeaths all his property to the trustees of the 'Epstein 2017 Trust'. The document outlines extensive powers granted to the executors for managing the estate's assets. This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, executed on June 1, 2017. It details the distribution of his estate, establishes a trust, and includes provisions to disinherit beneficiaries who contest the will. The document also outlines tax payment responsibilities for his executor and trustee.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The creator of the will, a resident of St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands, who is directing the disposition of his estate upon his death.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Appointed as one of the three primary executors of Jeffrey Epstein's will, responsible for administering his estate.

persons.context: Designated as a successor executor if any of the primary executors fail to qualify, are unable or unwilling to serve, or cease to act.

persons.name: Leo Liakakos
persons.context: One of the witnesses who signed Epstein's will on June 1, 2017, as attested in the affidavit.

events.title: Execution of Epstein's Will
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein signed his last will and testament, appointing executors and directing the distribution of his estate.

events.title: Creation of Epstein 2017 Trust
events.description: The 'Epstein 2017 Trust' was created under a trust agreement. Epstein's will directs that all his property be transferred to the trustees of this trust.

events.title: Execution of Epstein's Will
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein signed his last will and testament in the presence of witnesses and a notary public.

locations: St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's will was signed on August 8, 2019, just two days before his death in jail.
The will appoints Darren K. Indyke, Richard D. Kahn, and Terje R. Larsen as primary executors, granting them extremely broad powers to manage the estate without judicial oversight.
All of Epstein's property is bequeathed to the trustees of the 'Epstein 2017 Trust', a separate entity created in June 2017.
The executors are authorized to receive a fixed compensation of $250,000 each for their services.
The will includes a 'no-contest' clause, threatening to disinherit any beneficiary who challenges the will's validity.
Jeffrey E. Epstein executed his last will and testament on June 1, 2017.
The will establishes a trust and includes a 'no-contest' clause to disinherit any beneficiary who challenges the will or trust.
The executor is given discretion to pay estate taxes from the trust and to seek reimbursement from recipients of certain assets.
The document was witnessed by Leo Liakakos and Kathy Q. Shuhak and notarized by Habibe Avdiu.
